intro: Albizia welwitschioides, commonly known as the Namibian albizia, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its compound leaves, which are typically pinnate and arranged in pairs. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are usually pink or white, arranged in racemose inflorescences. Its bark is smooth and grayish, and it has a shallow root system adapted to arid conditions. Albizia welwitschioides is often found in savannas and along riverbanks, where it plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for local wildlife.
